content:
Perhaps if you can report the whole error message verbatim. I am pretty sure the important information comes after the word failed.

Google have traditionally been pretty good at offering a reason for their actions.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
My preferred method is to open the new PC copy, use the help menu > troubleshooting to get to the troubleshooting information and then click the show profile folder button. That shows where Thunderbird thinks all your profile should be and convincing it that it is actually somewhere else appears to be getting harder

Now close the new Thunderbird.

Copy the contents of your old machine profile folder into the one that just opened including sub folders, it will replace files if you are copying everything correctly so expect warning of that nature. If you do not get then your copy is not in the right place.

Once you have done the copying start Thunderbird and it should "just work"
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I think your domain is hosted by webhosthk.com, and their recommended settings for the outgoing server are:

wh.1025.hk, port 1025, STARTTLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

https://www.webhost.hk/Home/GetPDF?filename=Thunderbird_Setup_Manual_SpecialPort1025_ENG_WH.pdf

The incoming IMAP is: bodycarecocomhk.securemail.hk, 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

To avoid certificate error messages, disable antivirus scanning of email and secure connections.

content: View/Layout/Folder Pane to show the accounts, and View/Folders/Folder Pane Header to show the cloud (download) icon and the New Message button.
